org.codeseed.common.config

Class AnnotationPropertySource<A extends Annotation>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codeseed.common.config.AnnotationPropertySource<A>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - the type of annotation to trigger this property source
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertySource

    public abstract class AnnotationPropertySource<A extends Annotation>
extends Object
implements PropertySource
    A property source whose values are triggered by the presence of an annotation. If an annotation of the captured type variable A is not present on the configuration method, this property source will always return null; otherwise the property value is implementation specific.
    Author:
    Jeremy Gustie

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static PropertySource create(Iterable<? extends AnnotationPropertySource<?>> sources)
        Creates a property source backed by some number of annotation property sources. The resulting property source will consider annotations (in order) on configuration interface methods when trying to resolve property values. If the configuration method contains no annotations, this property source will always return null.
        Parameters:
        sources - the annotation property sources to aggregate
        Returns:
        a single property source which delegates to the supplied sources in annotation declaration order

      • create

        public static PropertySource create(AnnotationPropertySource<?>... sources)
        Creates a property source backed by some number of annotation property sources.
        Parameters:
        sources - the annotation property sources to aggregate
        Returns:
        a single property source which delegates to the supplied sources in annotation declaration order
        See Also:
        create(Iterable)

      • getProperty

        public final String getProperty(Method method)
        Description copied from interface: PropertySource
        Returns a property value or null if no such property is defined. Properties are looked up using the method from the configuration interface on which they are defined: this allows the lookup mechanism to consider things like the method name, annotation values or the name and/or package of the declaring class.
        Specified by:
        getProperty in interface PropertySource
        Parameters:
        method - the configuration method to look up
        Returns:
        property value, null if undefined

      • getProperty

        protected abstract String getProperty(Method method,
                                      A annotation)
        Returns a property value or null if no such property is defined. This is a specialized contract for a property which is triggered by an annotation.
        Parameters:
        method - the configuration method to look up
        annotation - the annotation which triggered this property lookup
        Returns:
        property value, null if undefined
